title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Community Blood Center/Community Tissue Services
Interview Descriptions: The process was fairly easy. The recruits will email or text you about setting up and interview with you. The interview itself was easy and about 30 min long. They explain the position and all that comes with it and there is room for questions and concerns. After the interview it'll be around a week before they contact you with a job offer or not.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join our community?

title: Process Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Community Blood Center/Community Tissue Services
Interview Descriptions: Interview with 1-2 people at a time, twice. A lot of the the typical interview questions. It’s rapid fire as well, so be prepared. They interview a group of people at a time just in different rooms
Interview Questions: What’s your biggest weakness? Tell me a time when you made a mistake and how you fixed it.

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Community Blood Center/Community Tissue Services (Dayton, OH)
Interview Descriptions: It takes a while do to multiple interviews; one of which is a "rapid fire" interview with multiple managers. Can be nerve wracking due to 2-5 managers all asking questions. If offered a position it may not be for what you applied for which id a little discouraging but on the up side you only have to be in a position 6 months before you can apply for a different department
Interview Questions: Tell us a time when you've been in a situation that required conflict resolution with a co worker and how you handled it.

title: Processing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Community Blood Center/Community Tissue Services (Kettering, OH) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Had to go through 3 separate interviews before being offered a position. Once hired, I was left on my own to learn tissue banking. I did not have any training or coaching whatsoever.
Interview Questions: How do make employees be accountable?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Community Blood Center/Community Tissue Services
Interview Descriptions: It honestly was them telling me what I'll need to do. They were in need of an intern for the summer. They asked about my projects and I told them. I had two people in the room with me and they went over my resume.

title: Research Associate Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Community Blood Center/Community Tissue Services (Dayton, OH) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: The main question asked was why I want to work at this location. besides that, they asked about my future goals and what I was studying at university. I was interviewed by the Director of Research and Development.
Interview Questions:
Why did you choose CTS as a place of employment?
What are your future goals?
What are you studying at University?

title: Donor Referral Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Community Blood Center/Community Tissue Services
Interview Descriptions: They do not allow you to contact them after you apply for a job. I received a call 2-3 weeks after I applied and did a phone interview and then one in person interview with my future boss, then I received an offer.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about being in a call center environment?

title: Receiving Tech Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Community Blood Center/Community Tissue Services
Interview Descriptions: I have only had one interview thus far. No word back yet, but the am told that they take a while to get back to ya. The interview was the most friendly I have ever encountered.
Interview Questions: What do you think your former employer would say about you?

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Community Blood Center/Community Tissue Services (Dayton, OH) in Jul 2013

title: Donor Room Services Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Community Blood Center/Community Tissue Services (Springdale, AR) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: Good, interview with local manager, did not talk with anyone from main office, Welcome feeling, good information, not open enough with hours that would need to be worked, or demands of the job.  No idea of when work would start or the pay you will receive.  Overall interview was lacking of information that should be given.
Interview Questions: No real difficult questions or unexpected questions were asked.  Time that would be required to go through educational process was not explained completely.  Away from home 6 weeks for training.
